description.para: These error names are used throughout the library.
Some platforms don't define them in errno.h, so we define them here using arbitrary values.

briefdescription.para: no message is available on the STREAM head read queue (POSIX.1)
invalid argument (POSIX.1)
input/output error (POSIX.1)
device or resource busy (POSIX.1)
file exists (POSIX.1)
no space left on device (POSIX.1)
no such file or directory (POSIX.1)
argument list too long (POSIX.1)
bad message (POSIX.1)
operation not supported (POSIX.1)
connection timed out (POSIX.1)
illegal byte sequence (POSIX.1, C99)
resource temporarily unavailable (POSIX.1)
function not implemented (POSIX.1)
permission denied (POSIX.1)
operation canceled (POSIX.1)
message too long (POSIX.1)
operation not permitted (POSIX.1)
A replacement for [struct] when defining a packed structure where the elements are not aligned based on type.

detaileddescription.para: Cached extended address register value.
Cached uint32_t register value.
Cached uint16_t register value.
Cached uint8_t register value.
The offsetof any given element will always be the offsetof plus sizeof the previous element. On platforms with gcc, it's defined as [struct attribute ((packed))]. Defaults to just [struct]
Cache status flags (_SXA_CACHED_OK etc.)

briefdescription.para: Enable CPU interrupts (at the level of the serial port driver, at least).

detaileddescription.para: INTERRUPT_DISABLE/INTERRUPT_ENABLE are used without nesting in the library, so these can be low-level functions or in-line assembler. Note that uses of these macros add a semicolon.

briefdescription.para: Disable CPU interrupts (at the level of the serial port driver, at least).
Defined by the platform as either 0 or 1, depending on whether code for the Wi-Fi XBee Module should be compiled in or not.
Functions with unused parameters (common due to the use of function pointers) can use this macro to dismiss compiler warnings about unused parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to [ (void) p ].

description.para: Macros related to supporting far (>16-bit) pointers.

briefdescription.para: On platforms with "far" pointers, define to the proper keyword; empty definition if not required.
On platforms with "far" pointers, define to a series of explicit casts to convert a "far" pointer back to "near".

detaileddescription.para: Only appropriate for pointers that are known to be near.

briefdescription.para: Literal string format specifier for printing a far string, typically "s".
Literal string format specifier for printing a far pointer, typically "p".

description.para: Macros typically defined in <inttypes.h>, define manually if inttypes.h is not available on this platform.

briefdescription.para: Format specifier for 16-bit unsigned (usually "u" or "hu")
Format specifier for 32-bit unsigned (usually "lu" or "u")
Format specifier for 16-bit lowercase hex (usually "x" or "hx")
Format specifier for 32-bit lowercase hex (usually "lx" or "x")
Format specifier for 16-bit uppercase hex (usually "X" or "hX")
Format specifier for 32-bit uppercase hex (usually "lX" or "X")
Default settings (no prefix).
Prefix each line with the memory offset (0000: xx xx xx).
Prefix each line with the address (uses p specifier) (000000: xx xx xx).
Prefix each line with a tab character.
Macro defined to.

detaileddescription.para: extern"C"{ when used by a C++ compiler. Used (along with XBEE_END_DECLS) for header file declarations to allow linking C-compiled code into C++ projects.

briefdescription.para: Macro defined to.

detaileddescription.para: } when used by a C++ compiler. Used (along with XBEE_BEGIN_DECLS) for header file declarations to allow linking C-compiled code into C++ projects.

briefdescription.para: For 1/1/1980 epoch (Rabbit), add 20 years, plus 5 leap days (1980, 1984, 1988, 1992, 1996) to get to ZigBee epoch of 1/1/2000.
For 1/1/1970 epoch (Win32, Unix), add 30 years, plus 7 leap days (1972, 1976, 1980, 1984, 1988, 1992, 1996) to get to ZigBee epoch of 1/1/2000.
Helper macro for calculating the number of entries in an array.
Compare two uint16_t timer values, with proper handling of rollover (e.g., 0xFFFF < 0x0000).

detaileddescription.para:
a
first timer value (cast to uint16_t)
op
operand (> or <) to use when comparing two timers
b
second timer value (cast to uint16_t)
The equivalent to "a op b". Note that when using the millisecond timer, you can only compare times within 32 seconds of each other.

briefdescription.para: Macro used to load a variable with an expiration time, later used with XBEE_CHECK_TIMEOUT_MS() macro.

detaileddescription.para: For timeouts longer than 32767 milliseconds (with less accuracy), use XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_SEC()/XBEE_CHECK_TIMEOUT_SEC().

parameterdescription.para: Timeout in milliseconds, from 1 to 32767.

simplesect.para: Value to assign to an unsigned 16-bit variable (uint16_t) for use with CHECK_TIMEOUT_MS().

briefdescription.para: Macro used to check a timer set by XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_MS().

detaileddescription.para: See the documentation for XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_MS() for a code example on proper use of this macro.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit variable set by XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_MS().
Time specified in call to XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_MS() has elapsed.
Time specified has not yet elapsed.

briefdescription.para: Macro used to load a variable with an expiration time, later used with XBEE_CHECK_TIMEOUT_SEC() macro.

detaileddescription.para: For a more precise timeout, for values of 30 seconds or less, use XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_MS()/XBEE_CHECK_TIMEOUT_MS() instead.

parameterdescription.para: Timeout in seconds, from 1 to 32767.

simplesect.para: Value to assign to an unsigned 16-bit variable (uint16_t) for use with XBEE_CHECK_TIMEOUT_SEC().

briefdescription.para: Macro used to check a timer set by XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_SEC().

detaileddescription.para: See the documentation for XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_SEC() for a code example on proper use of this macro.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit variable set by XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_SEC().
Time specified in call to XBEE_SET_TIMEOUT_SEC() has elapsed.
Time specified has not yet elapsed.

briefdescription.para: Platform-specific function to return the number of elapsed seconds.

detaileddescription.para: On some platforms, this is the equivalent of an "uptime".
On other platforms, it may reflect the value of the RTC, which might not be synchronized with a time server and might include leap seconds.
Regardless, it should consistently report elapsed time and not jump on clock synchronization.
In addition to determining timeouts, the ZCL Time Cluster makes use of it to report current time.
(Function name wrapped in parentheses so platforms can use a macro function of the same name.)

briefdescription.para: Platform-specific function to return the number of elapsed milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: OK for this counter to rollover. Used for timing and should have a resolution of at least 60ms.
(Function name wrapped in parentheses so platforms can use a macro function of the same name.)

briefdescription.para: Converts two hex characters (0-9A-Fa-f) to a byte.

parameterdescription.para: String of hex characters to convert.
Error (invalid character or string less than 2 bytes).
The byte represented by the first two characters of p.

briefdescription.para: This function is a non-blocking version of gets(), used to read a line of input from the user.

detaileddescription.para: It waits for a string from stdin terminated by a return. It should be called repeatedly, until it returns a value other than -EAGAIN. The input string, stored in buffer is null-terminated without the return.
The user should make sure only one process calls this function at a time.

parameterdescription.para: buffer to store input from user
size of buffer
User ended the input with a newline, return value is number of bytes written.
User has not completed a line.
NULL buffer or length is less than 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void FAR *address, uint16_t length, uint16_t flags)
memberdef.name: hex_dump

briefdescription.para: Helper function for printing a hex dump of memory to stdout.

detaileddescription.para: A reference implementation is provided in as util/hexdump.c. Dumps data in hex/printable format, 16 bytes to a line, to stdout.

parameterdescription.para: Address of data to dump.
Number of bytes to dump.

One of
HEX_DUMP_FLAG_NONE
HEX_DUMP_FLAG_OFFSET
HEX_DUMP_FLAG_ADDRESS
HEX_DUMP_FLAG_TAB

memberdef.argsstring: (const void FAR *src, int c, size_t length)
memberdef.name: memcheck

briefdescription.para: Test whether a block of memory is set to a single byte value.

parameterdescription.para: starting address
value to compare each byte to
number of bytes to compare
length bytes from src are set to c
length bytes from src would sort before length bytes of c
length bytes from src would sort before length bytes of c

briefdescription.para: Common header for Hardware Abstraction Layer.

detaileddescription.para: This file should be included by all other files in the library.

xrefdescription.para: find pre-processor macro to identify POSIX platform
